data.title: The checkbox widgets in the lobby settings panel aren't wide enough
data.body: This prevents you from being able to click on any part of the checkbox label text to check the associated checkbox.

data.title: Make captured hospitals in cnc/ra gradually heal all infantry units on the map
sounds in lobby
data.body:
Sometimes the sound stops working (the "ping" sound when messages are send, or someone enters the game)

I think the sounds should vary. Another sound for "someone enters the game" as chat sounds. 

Before the game starts something like a 5 sec countdown would be nice too (with sounds).

data.title: In-game kicking
data.body:
It should be possible to kick players (and spectators) while playing a game. Sometimes a troll doesn't reveal themselves as a troll until you have already started playing a game.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/447905-in-game-kicking?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Units inside of pillboxes do not level up
data.body:
To reproduce:
1. Put a unit inside a pillbox (or use the default rifleman who is already there).
2. Have the unit in the pillbox kill a lot of enemies.

Expected result: the unit levels up.

Actual result: the unit is as noobishly green as he was before he killed an army or two.

data.title: Infantry exiting APC take too long to comply with orders
data.body: When an infantry exits an apc, and the player quickly orders the infantry to move right after the infantry has exited the apc; what infact happens is the infantry continues moving out of the apc in its traditional vector to some type of drop zone, completely ignoring the orders from the player. This is very annoying and causes engineer rushes to completely fail, when an engineer riding in an apc is taged with a team number and quickly called upon to move as it exits the apc, the engineer completely ignores the orders. This is a bad problem.

data.title: Allied Anti-Tank Mine layers' mines kill friendly vehciles.
data.body:
Before the current stable release the Allies' Anti-Tank (AT) mine layers' mines were indestructable. In the current release they are destructable, however they pose an equal threat to all vehicles, which is unfair to the player since it takes great effort to safely make sure the mines can be deployed in an area without enemy units present. Also keep in mind the mine layer dies VERY fast, its weak, and not a cheap unit to produce, and on top of that only carries 3 mines total. So it would be fair to make the mines not harm friendly vehicles.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/447911-allied-anti-tank-mine-layers-mines-kill-friendly-vehciles?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Selection / control groups don't play nicely with cargo
data.body:
There are some situations (I don't have a reliable repro case) where unit selections interacts badly with cargo.
- Units in a transport can be selected, showing the selection rectangle at the position that they entered the transport.
- When repeatedly commanding units in a group to enter a transport, units already inside will sometimes exit.

I'm not sure where there issues creep in, as the selection does appear to prune actors outside the world each tick.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/447915-selection-control-groups-don-t-play-nicely-with-cargo?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: MAKE: refactor Makefile

milestone.title: release-20131223
milestone.description: The next stable release should not have obvious glitches or horrible crasher bugs left.

data.body:
improved readability, moved tools at the top, rules at the bottom

make -> build core
make all -> build core and tools
install -> install core
install-all -> install core and tools

data.title: Make OpenRA yaml comply to yaml standards.
data.body: Since not all of us use the C# dev tools, it might be good to adhere to the yaml standard. Might save a lot of time writing broken-yaml parser tools (=

data.title: Remove redundant explosion bits and fix lonestar mig contrails
data.body: Adjusting positions with sequence offsets instead. We did not have the Offset feature when commit 0719b89cdfee0016e6191cadbb0978c448d2ab8d was accepted. Not sure if I guessed the values correctly @reaperrr did manually in his paint job.
